content: The emulator itself runs flawlessly as far as I've experienced. The only issues I'm having are that my turbo buttons no longer appear and I can't hold down the A or B buttons anymore, they just press and release instantly. Been an issue for about a month or so and had no reply after emailing the dev. Overall a wonderful GBC emulator, just not the best support experience.
Love it. Works super well! Just needs a built in rom browser with cover artwork, rather than the basic/ugly file browser.

Amazing emulator! Even the free version is great, but I wanted to unlock the extra features and support the developer. Runs great and the skin options are pretty cool. The only thing I would add is an even softer vibration feedback setting. (if that's even realistic)

Okay I guess. Got it because looked amazing and sounded amazing. And it's great. But id sort of like a refund now after seeing the "cheat manager". Trying to mess around and have fun in my games but you can't even add multi line cheats from I can see, I've tried everything I can think of and it's menus are sort of garbage. I'm saying this whole thing is. It's great. But don't advertise and say you have cheat manager when you certainly don't.

GAMEBOY CAMERA...CAMERA SUPPORT!! I've honestly been searching to see if this has been made possible and finally I've found it... Wow my mind is blown. Very well done, the emulator works great with other games too but honestly it's worth it just for the fact you can take authentic Gameboy camera photos using your phone camera aaaaaand export them! Wow
Great app, but wish i could move the save buttons and menu buttons to middle of screen in portrait mode, right under the gb display

Great emulator. But if you use roms from the free version and restore files have the wrong color palette save in game and load the rom and load the save file through the game and itll restore the palette to the actual ones.

content: Works great! I like that I can customize the button sizes. Can you update the storage setup to use Android's new Scoped Storage, and in particular have the "pizzaboy" directory be internal to the app? That way it won't need the storage permission, and won't clutter the filesystem with app-specific folders. If this is done, the SAF can still be used to add ROMs (no storage permission needed).

I think the bar is a great idea, but I, for example, never use slowdown, but like a greater range of options in speedup. Like, I would rather have normal > 2x > 3x > 4x > 8x > 16x > ultra than any slowdown option at all. MyOldBoy is clunkier in execution, but a good example of both of these options.

content:
The best emulator. It emulates perfectly the game. But also the console 
with the detailed graphics interface... and plenty parameters to 
customise!!!

The best emulator, has no adds even on the free version, and I love the 
changeable gameboy interface with 5 different speed options. I can breeze 
through the early Pokemon games at high speed, or just enjoy the beautiful 
music sound haunting at lower speeds.
Great emulator

I have absolutely no choice but to update my review to a maximum of 5 
stars. I moved from gbc.emu to this because the UI and beautiful design of 
this emu blew me away. There are working emulators and then there is this 
emulator with skins to make it look like an old Gameboy or Gameboy color. 
On top of that the buttons have animations when being pressed and you can 
also adjust vibration if you like. These features pull you in in a way that 
no other emulator will. It makes this emulator not just functional but FUN. 
I want to keep going back to old games with this emu just to keep enjoying 
and playing with the skins, buttons, and user interface. I can even size 
and place my own images on the Gameboy itself to create the illusion of 
having put stickers on it. Now the reason I originally did not give 5 stars 
was because there was a described feature of automatically saving your game 
state and reloading it whenever and however you close the app and reload 
it. I found that feature was not working for some games and they would 
always reboot. The developer actually kept contact with me through email 
and to my amazement in a few short days he completely fixed the issue with 
updates! Amazing and now this is the Gameboy Color emulator of my dreams! 
Better believe if this developer releases emulators of this quality for 
other consoles that I would gladly pay to support the project. Not 
exaggerating when I say best gbc emulator for android, and I am picky with 
my emulators. 5/5
replyContent: Glad we sorted it! I have to thank you for all the feedback you gave me. It was very helpful!

content:

This emulator is THE best for emulating Gameboy and Gameboy Colour on android. The accuracy is great, especially for its sound! Input lag is minimal, has very little impact on battery. Lots of cool options (Like super game boy boarders and Gameboy overlays). Excellent!
How do you add cheats?
replyContent: Hi Frank! Load a rom, go into cheats menu, insert the code and give it a name. Then click on "add/modify cheat" and it will appear on lower menu. Then you can turn it on/off by clicking on checkbox.

content: Great emulator but I'd like to request a couple of features. I'd love to be able to choose where my .sav file is stored (I'd pick the SD card in case my phone takes a trip into the toilet and the SD card is the only thing recoverable). I'd also like to be able to set emulation speed to "As fast as possible" via a toggle similar to how MyOldBoy does it.  This would be a separate speed from the existing speed bar and would mostly help with things like hatching eggs in Pokemon games.
replyContent: Nice! I can consider to put'em on next releases. In the meanwhile you can hack .sav file location by putting rom and its .sav on the SD card. The folder of the loaded rom is the first place where pizza boy is looking for a .sav file. In case it's not present it fallback on "/internal memory/pizzaboy/save/". Where you'd put the "ultra speed" button?

content: Great emulator, this being my first android. One quick question is it possible to move the save state and load state buttons that sit on the bottom? Accidentally pushed the load one a couple of times. Cheers

content: The author isn't exaggerating; this is incredibly detailed and accurate. If you're wanting to emulate anything GB or GBC, this should absolutely be your choice. Great performance and no serious battery drain!

Just a quick heads up if you want to buy it.... You can customize the colour of the Gameboy colour that it shows by going into the settings and finding Skin. Also, you can change the screen if you're playing Pokemon yellow just tap the screen and it will play like the Gameboy. Pretty amazing!

A great emulator! Slight issue with the sound. Certain sounds in games don't sound right. May just be my tablet (Lenovo Yoga Tab 3 plus with Qualcomm Snapdragon 652) Will check on another device (Update: 18/12) Patch has worked great! Sound is spot on now! Thanks for the quick response!!!
replyContent: You're right! I've just updated the app with a patch! Please let me know if it sound ok now ;)

content: Best Emulator in the store

This is definitely one of the best if not THE best emulator I have ever used. This is well worth the money. I am a big fan of the extra speed toggle option in this paid version. Definitely a great piece of software. My saves synced effortlessly from free to pro. Only one complaint through which is not game breaking... whenever the screen is rotated the toggle speed gets reset to default. Which is negligible. Just thought I would mention it in case you were not aware! Great job though dev! Recommend this!

Emulator works great. Easy to navigate interface, and I love the ability to customize the color/stickers. Seems the creator is real attentive which is nice. The app has an extremely low battery drain which is a huge benefit. The d-pad felt a little sticky at first, but the ability to fine tune some of the ui took care of that. Just turned off the d-pad center, and it plays like a dream. Can't be easy to simulate a d-pad on a touch screen, but this feels right. Thanks for delivering a quality product!
Amazing quality emulator. Really feature complete and works well. Thanks so much for this

The only thing  better than this app is the developer behind it. Not only did he contact me directly before I even purchased it and when I Google Play was giving me issues actually purchasing it, he listens to his customers and continually tweaks his app to make sure we got all the latest features and bug fixes.
I absolutely love this emulator! It runs games so well, and I had so much fun making pokemon stickers to decorate the UI with.

content: For the most part, not a bad emulator.   Visually, it's definitely the most accurate Gameboy emulator out there. Love the options to add the motion blur and the good-old spinach green color palette, thus giving the original Gameboy games an authentic look (which many other emulators on the Playstore seem to lack) and the recent addition of the classic Gameboy border is a nice touch.   There is, however, one crippling flaw I can't get past; The directional controls.  When I use my Bluetooth controller (which is a PS4 controller by the by, if that helps), I can only move in 4 directions as opposed to 8. It's crippling in certain games like Link's Awakening (limits Link's mobility) and the Wario Land series (prevents me from high jumping and crouching while moving).  Is there any way to fix this?  Edit: The control issue has been fixed for the most part. Still doesn't work properly on the analog, however that is small potatoes as the control issues have been completely ironed out on the d-pad, which is where it REALLY counts.  I have, however, came across another glitch; the color palette for the sprites in certain games invert whilst in Super Gameboy mode. It seems to happen in the cutscenes for Donkey Kong 94 (and only the cutscenes, minor really) and the entirety of Donkey Kong Land (major)  Edit 2: Wow this dude works fast. :)  I really appreciate how approachable the developer is as he listens to feedback and goes out of his way to fix the glitches reported immediately. This emulator gets better with each update and is pretty much on it's way of becoming the BGB of android GBC emulators.
replyContent:
Mr Zappa thank you for the review and for reporting me the external pad bug. I'll investigate ASAP. Have a nice day

Update Jun 19th: The bug should be fixed! Let me know if it works correctly now ^^

Update Jun 20th: Now the analog bug should be fixed with the latest version (1.8.5). I also fixed SGB palette problem. Let me know! XD
